root_causes: Script flags missing responses even though question_attributes.NotRequired is true (should not treat missing as an error).
Custom validation referenced in expected logic (validateB5d("S7_2","B4nx2_4","hDUMB4nCol2_2","B4nDKx2")) is not implemented.
ColumnMask condition (MaskSec2Cols().isect(set("2")).size() > 0) is not applied when deciding whether to validate this column.
Precision requirement (Precision: 4) is not enforced — no check on decimal places.
Only a simple range(0,9999) check is implemented; other expected constraints/validation logic are missing.
instructions: Do not flag missing values as errors because NotRequired = true. Change the selection condition from sel if miss(v) or ~range(v,0,9999) to select only non-missing invalid values, e.g. sel if ~miss(v) and ~range(v,0,9999).

Implement the custom validation called out in the question_attributes: call or replicate validateB5d("S7_2","B4nx2_4","hDUMB4nCol2_2","B4nDKx2") so the specific cross-field rules are enforced in addition to the numeric range.

Apply the ColumnMask condition when deciding whether to validate these sub-variables. Wrap the validation/listing in an additional condition that MaskSec2Cols().isect(set("2")).size() > 0 is true for this column.

Enforce the 4-decimal precision requirement. Add an explicit check that values have at most 4 decimal places (e.g. test that rounded(v,4)=v or check integer(v*10000)=v*10000) and include those cases in the listing of invalid values.
Keep the numeric bounds check (0 to 9999) but combine it with the column mask, precision check, and the custom validateB5d logic so all expected validation conditions are covered.

root_causes: Script flags missing responses even though question_attributes.NotRequired is true (missing should not be treated as an error).
Custom validation referenced in expected logic (validateB5d("S7_3","B4nx3_4","hDUMB4nCol3_2","B4nDKx3")) is not implemented.
ColumnMask condition (MaskSec2Cols().isect(set("3")).size() > 0) is not applied when deciding whether to validate this column.
Precision requirement (Precision: 4) is not enforced — no check on decimal places.
Only a simple range(0,9999) check is implemented; other expected constraints/validation logic are missing.
instructions: Do not flag missing values as errors because NotRequired = true. Change sel if miss(v) or ~range(v,0,9999) to select only non-missing invalid values, e.g. sel if ~miss(v) and ~range(v,0,9999).
Implement the custom validation validateB5d("S7_3","B4nx3_4","hDUMB4nCol3_2","B4nDKx3") so the cross-field and question-specific rules are enforced.
Apply the ColumnMask condition for this column: only run the validation/listing when MaskSec2Cols().isect(set("3")).size() > 0.
Add an explicit check to enforce the 4-decimal precision (e.g. require rounded(v,4)=v or integer test on v*10000) and include precision violations in the output.
Combine the numeric bounds check (0..9999) with the column mask, precision check, and the custom validation so all expected validation conditions are covered.

root_causes: Variable name mismatch: expected variable ID in spec is B4nDKx1_5 but the script references B4nDKx1.
ColumnMask condition (MaskSec2Cols().isect(set("1")).size() > 0) is not implemented — expected to validate only when that mask applies.
Question_attributes mention AutoCheckOther but no handling/notes for other/special codes are present (if applicable).
instructions: Use the correct variable name as specified: replace references to B4nDKx1 with B4nDKx1_5 (the expected Variable ID).
Enforce the ColumnMask condition when validating: only check/list respondents when MaskSec2Cols().isect(set("1")).size() > 0.

Ensure the check validates against the single allowed code (5). The logic should list cases where MaskSec2Cols condition is true and (miss(B4nDKx1_5) or B4nDKx1_5 <> 5) if the question is required; if missing is allowed per metadata, change miss handling accordingly.
If the survey uses special codes (97/98/99) or AutoCheckOther behavior, add explicit handling so those codes are treated per spec.
